main event: Two witnesses observed an orange disc-shaped object emerge from a cloud, move across the sky, and then disappear back into the cloud, near Troy, Ohio on August 25, 1966.
interesting points: The object was seen to come out of a cloud, move rapidly, and then go back behind a cloud.
The object had a metallic, disc-like appearance and emitted a bright blue-white light that remained constant during the sighting.
The object was estimated to be approximately 40-50 feet in diameter and fly at an altitude of 500-1000 feet.
The object made an erratic movement, coming to a brief stop and then continuing on its course, without making any sound.
The sighting lasted for 16-20 minutes and was observed by the witness and three other people.
